Articles.Content: You, hear that crew? We have a hype prediction to meet! I know that you all have been going through some impossible G's, but were going to speed up a little if that is ok with everybody.

> 
> Because i have it taken:cool:

Join date: Dec 2013

Not many members then.
looks like the store site is under maintenance - good sign...
Scott had ModuleManager in 1.0?
Does anybody have any idea about how less delta-v we will use to get into orbit? It seems that the atmosphere in 1.0 will be way thinner than real life (IMO), thus reducing the necessary D-v a lot.

> 
> Scott had ModuleManager in 1.0?

I have no idea, but given that Sarbian is the one who made ModuleManager and also has access to the experimentials, I wouldn;t be surprised if it was already set up for 1.0

Squad no....![;.;](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cry.gif)

![mpWASOK.png](http://i.imgur.com/mpWASOK.png)
KasperVld just hinted in Twitch chat that the hidden in the merch giveaway is a riddle.
Attempted to go to the main site, and apparently Squad is doing a Server Migration.

Here is the exchange.

![N0YcvF1.png](http://i.imgur.com/N0YcvF1.png)

When I reloaded FF which had the deltaV map (the old one) because FF was derping out, the page with the deltaV map said:

[h=1]Server Migration[/h] Kerbal Space Program website is in maintenance mode while we are performing a Server Migration.

 We appreciate your patience.

 - Squad Team

Ok, it seems we have jumped aprox. 40 pages so far today.

Hype on!

And I believe we broke the 183/184 one already.

Also, nuke engine burns are LOONNGG
Yeah, the KSP website is down for me too. That increases my hype for some reason...

> 
> KasperVld just hinted in Twitch chat that the hidden in the merch giveaway is a riddle.

Not really much of a riddle though

> 
> And I believe we broke the 183/184 one already.
> Also, nuke engine burns are LOONNGG

They are also 3 Tons now.
Speaking of the deltaV map, any idea when someone will make a new one? No idea who made that old one. something nsomething pink walrus icon, no idea.

> 
> Attempted to go to the main site, and apparently Squad is doing a Server Migration.

I think that we accidentally ddos'd the forums, so they got worried about the main site for when 1.0 hits.

![0EyEl57.png](http://i.imgur.com/0EyEl57.png)

CURRENT STATUS OMG

> 
> They are also 3 Tons now.

I'm actually using RoverDudes LH fuelled nuke engines atm.

> 
> Does anybody have any idea about how less delta-v we will use to get into orbit? It seems that the atmosphere in 1.0 will be way thinner than real life (IMO), thus reducing the necessary D-v a lot.

They rebalanced the ISP on all the vanilla engines, probably to take them down a notch to compensate for FAR atmo.
Every time I comment here, there's already another 3 pages added ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

> 
> Not really much of a riddle though

The first question of the poll might be the riddle.

> 
> The first question of the poll might be the riddle.

Yeah, I got that much, and its not really that much of a riddle.

> 
> They rebalanced the ISP on all the vanilla engines, probably to take them down a notch to compensate for FAR atmo.

Also, they weren't fully balanced to begin with. Radial engines are probably the only ones left unchanged.
